tasks.task: Assessing greenhouse and high tunnel structure choices
subtasks: Considering plants intended for growth
Evaluating material options for structure construction
Recognizing lifespan of polyfilm and polycarbonate cover materials
Accounting for material costs in decision-making
Addressing heat management through proper venting and cooling systems
Noting University of Wyoming's involvement in high tunnel and greenhouse structures
Identifying sources of structural guidance (University of Wyoming Extension)

tasks.task: Selecting a high tunnel or greenhouse structure
subtasks: Assessing plant growth requirements
Evaluating material options (polyfilm, polycarbonate, glass)
Comparing material costs and longevity
Considering venting and cooling methods

tasks.task: Researching high tunnel and greenhouse information
subtasks: Consulting University of Wyoming Extension publications

tasks.task: Choosing a high tunnel or greenhouse structure
subtasks: Consider plants to grow
Evaluate material options (poly, polycarbonate, glass)
Compare costs and durability of materials
Inspect cooling and ventilation methods (e.g., roll-up sides, vents)

tasks.task: Preparing to build a high tunnel or greenhouse
subtasks: Measure necessary materials
Cut materials (depending on the structure design)
Assemble the structure (requires physical assembly)

tasks.task: Choosing high tunnel or greenhouse materials
subtasks: Determine plant growth needs
Evaluate material costs
Assess material lifespan and allowing for replacement
Consider heat management options (ventilation)
Comparing different materials (polyfilm vs polycarbonate)
Checking costs of materials
Assessing material durability (lifespan)
Handling materials to check ease of use

tasks.task: Choosing between different greenhouse materials (polyfilm, polycarbonate, glass) based on their lifespan, cost, and suitability for plant growth.
subtasks: Compare the durability (lifespan) of polycarbonate and polyfilm materials.
Evaluate the costs associated with different materials (poly and polycarbonate are less expensive but have a limited lifespan).
Assess the thermal management options (venting and cooling) necessary for the chosen material.

tasks.task: Choosing between polyfilm, polycarbonate, and glass for a high tunnel.
subtasks: Compare lifespan (polyfilm/polycarbonate: 5-7 years; glass: durable)
Compare costs (polyfilm/polycarbonate less expensive; glass more expensive)
Consider venting and cooling options (doors, roll-up sides, top vents)

tasks.task: Choosing between polyfilm, polycarbonate, and glass for a high tunnel or greenhouse
subtasks: Comparing the lifespan of materials (polyfilm and polycarbonate last 5-7 years; glass is more durable)
Evaluating costs (polyfilm and polycarbonate are less expensive, but have a shorter lifespan)
Considering heat management through proper venting and cooling systems (doors, roll-up sides, or vents at the top)
